headline: Hot Water Cornbread
description: This hot water cornbread is an old-fashioned Southern recipe for easy-to-make cornmeal cakes fried in a skillet in shortening until crisp and golden.
name: Hot Water Cornbread
recipeIngredient: 1 cup bacon grease, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cornmeal, salt, and sugar in a medium bowl. Add boiling water and 1 tablespoon bacon grease; stir until bacon grease melts melts.
Pour bacon grease to a depth of 1/2-inch in a large skillet; heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Shape cornmeal mixture into 12 flattened balls using a heaping tablespoon as a measuring guide.
Fry, turning once, in hot oil until crisp and golden brown, about 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

My rating on this is no reflection on this recipe. My family would not like the added Ingredients. . My post here is a version of this. My husband's family has been making this version for years. We only use stone ground mill cornmeal. This makes a huge difference. Easier to find in small towns in the south. We put whatever amount we're going to make in a large flatter type soup bowl. We measure salt by topping the top of the mound with salt(like a snow top mountain). We add enough water so it's between thick and thin. Cover bottom of frying pan with oil and drop by tablespoon. If you like your cornbread crunchier then make the batter a little thinner. My husband would neve want sugar in his fried cornbread.
